New Records: Oklahoma City's Shai Gilgeous-Alexander and Isaiah Joe combined for 70 points
Key Match Events: The Thunder kept their foot on the pedal in the second, pouring in 39 points to take a mammoth 70-43 halftime lead

Gilgeous-Alexander spearheaded another dazzling offensive performance from the Thunder, finishing with 39 points from 15-of-21 shooting while Joe caught fire with eight three-pointers off the bench to deliver a 31-point display
Pre-Game Insights: The game had been billed as a potential NBA Finals preview
Post-Match Reflections: Oklahoma City's win saw them stretch their lead to 31-6 at the top of the Western Conference standings, six games ahead of the second-placed Houston Rockets

Celtics coach Joe Mazzulla said 'When you're having inefficient offense, it puts pressure on your defense, And if you're only going to shoot 28% from three, it means you're going to have to do a lot of other things really, really, really well. We've got to do better.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Giannis Antetokounmpo spoiled Paolo Banchero's return from injury after a 34-game absence with a 41-point masterpiece to give the Milwaukee Bucks a 109-106 win over the Magic
The New Orleans Pelicans shrugged off the absence through suspension of Zion Williamson to defeat the 76ers 123-115
Others: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander drove to the net on his way to a 39-point haul in Oklahoma City's victory over the New York Knicks on Friday
